study_plan_entry.title: Creative Problem Solving in Science and Engineering

free_text.Content: Curriculum (Theoretical part)[br/]1.	Neurochemical basis of learning and creative processes in the brain[br/]2.	Behavioural and chemical influences on creativity[br/]3.	Personality traits of highly creative individuals (M. Csikszentmihalyi)[br/]4.	Objective testing of the originality of thinking[br/]5.	Group creativity: Brainstorming (A. Osborn)[br/]6.	Creativity training: Lateral thinking (E. de Bono)[br/]7.	Systematic problem solving (G. Polya)[br/]8.	Morphological analysis and the morphological box (F. Zwicky)[br/]9.	Lateral thinking puzzles and systematic solution approaches[br/][br/]Curriculum (Practical part)[br/]1.	Brainstorming exercises (Plenum)[br/]2.	Lateral thinking puzzles (Plenum)[br/]3.	Systematic solution of a tough scientific/engineering problem (Small groups)[br/]4.	Poster preparation (Groups: Problem+Process+Solution)[br/]5.	Debriefing session[br/]
free_text.Keywords: Creativity, systematic problem solving, morphological analysis, Polya approach, lateral thinking
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Basic education (bachelor level) in an engineering or scientific discipline
